channel.title: Confusion with NoScript in the Tor browser in Whonix Workstation
channel.description:
It seems to me that a lot of javascript code is still running in my browser e.g. when I search in DuckDuckGo, it fills in search matches as I type.
Isn't the usual behavior of NoScript to block this?

item.title: Confusion with NoScript in the Tor browser in Whonix Workstation
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
rob75:

Isn’t the usual behavior of NoScript to block this?

By default javascript is enabled in Tor Browser.

https://whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Security_vs_Usability_Trade-off

Read full topic
item.source: Confusion with NoScript in the Tor browser in Whonix Workstation

item.title: Confusion with NoScript in the Tor browser in Whonix Workstation
item.dc:creator: _def
item.description:
On the left there is a little icon. If you click it you get a selection menu with an entry security settings. There are 3 options. The lowest allows all scripts to run. The highest disables script as default. It is linked to the noscript settings.

Read full topic
item.source: Confusion with NoScript in the Tor browser in Whonix Workstation
